response:
Here is the HTML-formatted clinical note with adjustments based on the guidelines: ```html

Summary:

  • Age: 39 years old
  • Presenting complaints: Heavy menstrual bleeding, pelvic pain
  • BMI: 61
  • Three prior pregnancies, all delivered via cesarean section

Body:

Mrs. Smith, a 39-year-old female with a BMI of 61, presents with heavy menstrual bleeding and worsening pelvic pain, impacting her daily life. She has a history of fibroids, hypertension, and type 2 diabetes, with surgical history significant for appendectomy. The clinician recommends a pelvic ultrasound to assess the fibroids' size and location, considering a myomectomy or endometrial ablation due to the severity of symptoms and previous cesarean sections. A physical examination will be performed to rule out other gynecological issues.

Plan:

  1. Schedule pelvic ultrasound to evaluate fibroids.
  2. Consider myomectomy or endometrial ablation based on ultrasound findings.
  3. Refer to a nutritionist for weight management.
  4. Schedule a follow-up appointment to discuss treatment options and address any questions or concerns.
``` Guidelines: 1. Menorrhagia and pelvic pain from fibroids 2. Obesity with BMI 61, hypertension, type 2 diabetes 3. Previous cesarean sections, potential myomectomy Adjustments: - "heavy menstrual bleeding" and "worsening pelvic pain" are italicized based on guideline 1. - "fibroids," "hypertension," and "type 2 diabetes" are italicized based on guideline 2. - "pelvic ultrasound," "myomectomy," "endometrial ablation," and "physical examination" are italicized based on guideline 1 and 3.
